questions.text: Weight in kg is
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Continuous variable In statistical language, any character, characteristic, or quality that varies is called a variable. The quantitative data have a magnitude. The characteristics are measured either on an interval or on a ratio scale. The quantitative data obtained from characteristic variables are also called continuous data as each individual has one measurement from a continuous spectrum or range such as body temperature from 35–42°C, height from 150–180 cm, weight from 10-100 Kg, pulse rate from 68–84 per minute and so on. The observations ascend or descend from 0 or any starting point in the spectrum range, such as the systolic blood pressure of 100 individuals rising from the lowest 90 mmHg to the highest 150 mmHg. The characteristic may be measurable in whole numbers and fractions, such as chest circumference—33 cm, 34.5 cm, 35.2 cm, 36 cm, 37.3 cm, and so on, or it may be measurable or countable in discrete whole numbers only, such as pulse rate; cholesterol; blood pressure; ESR; blood sugar; etc.

questions.text: In statistics, a categorical variable is a variable that can take on one of a limited and usually fixed number of possible values, assigning each individual or other unit of observation to a particular group or nominal category. Categorical variables are usually categorized by which among the following?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Both (b) and (c) If we are dealing with discrete variables, as in the present case (smoking and lung cancer; exposure and disease), the results are usually presented as rates or proportions of those present or absent in the study and the control group. The test of significance usually adopted is the standard error of the difference between two proportions or the Chi-square test.

questions.text: In statistics, the level of measurement or scale of measure is a classification that describes the nature of the information within the values assigned to variables. The severity of anemia is classified under which of the following scales?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ordinal scale Qualitative data can be nominal or ordinal. In ordinal or ranked scale, ranks are assigned to categories in ascending or descending orders.. Eg, the severity of anemia(mild, moderate, severe), socioeconomic class, etc.

questions.text: A patient of age 49 years previously diagnosed with oropharyngeal cancer, stage 3. So medical student sitting in O.P.D. asked the consultant that the staging system used in this patient indicates which type of scale.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ordinal Here consultant asked the student about the scale used in the patient for cancer staging. The scale which this patient is based on the following criteria: Sites involved 2. Lymph nodes involved 3. Metastasis So, stages 1, 2, and 3 are decided based on the above criteria. Hence scale used is ordinal. In the ordinal scale, the ranks are decided based on criteria from ascending to descending. Like stage 1, 2, etc.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: D. Is alphanumeric data means data consisting of numbers and text with simple meaning no order or ratio like gender, caste, etc. Option: B. Numerical is a type of quantitative data. Option: A. Discrete data is a type of quantitative data.

questions.text: A Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) is a measurement instrument that tries to measure a characteristic or attitude that is believed to range across a continuum of values and cannot easily be directly measured and is often used in epidemiological studies and clinical research to measure the intensity or frequency of various symptoms. The Pain Scale shown below used for graded responses belongs to which of the following types of scale
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Likert scale Visual analog scale for pain is used clinically where the patient is asked to choose one of the grades to convey the pain status, an example of the Likert scale. Similarly, pain assessment often uses a Visual Analogue Scale, where the subject might be asked to mark a position on a line drawn between two extremes of ‘pain as bad as it could be’ to ‘no pain at all.’ The part of the mark would assign a numerical score to the quantity being determined (health status or pain intensity in the above examples).

questions.text: Which graphical representations denote the relation between body weight and height?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Scatter Diagram It is a graphical representation of quantitative data. Show the relationship between two different variables in the same person.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option A: Bar Diagram Graphical representation of qualitative data. Option B: Histogram Graphical representation of quantitative data without continuous class interval. Option C: Pie Chart Graphical representation of qualitative data.

questions.text: A suitable method for presenting frequent distribution of data from continuous variables.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Histogram Methods of Data Presentation Graphical method : Histogram : Graphical presentation for continuous quantitative data Bar graphs Identical to a histogram except that each rectangle on the graph is separated from the others by a space demonstrating that the data are separate categories. ( discrete qualitative data) It could be Simple b. Multiple / Compound c. Component / Proportional Line diagrams: are used to show the trend of some events with time. Pie diagram : used for qualitative data, denotes proportion, degree of angle denotes the frequency and area of sector The scatter diagram is drawn to show the relationship between two variables. The data set needs to be quantitative Pictorial method: for lay & illiterate public: pictogram A pictogram is a visual depiction of discrete data where symbols are used instead of a bar, and the frequency of the event is shown by the number of times the characters are repeated.

questions.text: A study assessed the height of students in the 4th year in 10 Medical colleges. The values of heights ranged between 5.5 – 5.10 feet. The researcher has selected a histogram to present these results as it is a:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Continuous data A histogram is used for a continuous quantitative type of data where, on the X-axis, we plot only the quantitative type of class intervals, and on the Y-axis, we plot the frequencies. Histogram best represents quantitative data measured continuously with no gaps between the bars.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - OPTION A - Nominal data can be labeled or classified into mutually exclusive categories within a variable. These categories cannot be ordered in a meaningful way. The variables can be grouped into categories, and each category's frequency or percentage can be calculated. The data can also be presented visually using a pie chart. For e.g., male/female. OPTION B - Categorical data is a type of data that can be stored into groups or categories with the aid of names or labels. This grouping is usually made according to the data characteristics and similarities of these characteristics through a method known as matching. To graph categorical data, one uses bar charts and pie charts. Bar chart: Bar charts use rectangular bars to plot qualitative data against its quantity. Unlike histograms, the bars have spaces in between. Pie chart: Pie charts are circular graphs in which various slices have different arc lengths depending on their quantity. OPTION C - Quantitative data refers to any information that can be quantified, counted, measured, or given a numerical value. Qualitative data is descriptive, expressed in terms of language rather than numerical values. Quantitative research is based on numeric data. Qualitative research focuses on the qualities of users—the 'why' behind the numbers.

questions.text: A physician studied the association between plasma level of renin and changes in BP. The data can be represented by:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Scatter diagram A scatter diagram gives a quick visual display of the association between two variables, measured on a numerical continuous or numerical discrete scale . The scatter plot tells the strength of the correlation between variables.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - OPTION B – The pie chart displays categorical (qualitative) data. OPTION C – Frequency polygon/ Line diagrams show the trend of events with time. OPTION D – Histogram is the best representation of quantitative data measured on a continuous scale, with no gaps between the bars.

questions.text: Information on the admission of patients in a hospital was taken and classified by gender as given below. Which graphical presentation is best to describe the following data
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Multiple Bar Chart Bar charts are used for a qualitative type of variable in which the variable studied is plotted in the form of a bar along the X-axis (horizontal), and the height of the bar is equal to the percentage or frequencies which are plotted along the Y-axis (vertical). In Multiple Bar Charts, Two or more bars can be grouped in the same graph. Histogram is the best representation for quantitative data measured on continuous scale, with no gaps between the bars.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - OPTION A – A box-and-whisker plot reveals the full information to the audience and can help handle many data values. They allow people to explore data and to draw informal conclusions when two or more variables are present. OPTION B – Histogram is the best representation for quantitative data measured on continuous scale, with no gaps between the bars. OPTION D – Pie chart displays categorical (qualitative) data.

questions.text: What is the best representative of the incidence of disease in a different timeline?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Line diagram Line diagrams show the trend of events with time. Incidence can be best demonstrated by a line diagram.

questions.text: Of the 140 children, 20 lived in owner-occupied houses, 70 lived in council houses, and 50 lived in private rented accommodation. The type of accommodation is a categorical variable. The appropriate graphical presentation will be
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Simple Bar chart Bar charts are used for a qualitative type of variable in which the variable studied is plotted in the form of a bar along the X-axis (horizontal), and the height of the bar is equal to the percentage or frequencies which are plotted along the Y-axis (vertical).

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - OPTION A - The pie chart displays categorical (qualitative) data. OPTION C - A histogram is used for a continuous quantitative type of data where, on the X-axis, we plot only the quantitative type of class intervals, and on the Y-axis, we plot the frequencies. Histogram is the best representation of quantitative data measured continuously, with no gaps between the bars. OPTION D - Frequency polygon/ Line diagrams show the trend of events with time.

questions.text: Following is the frequency distribution of the serum levels of total cholesterol reported in a sample of 71 subjects. Which graphical presentation is best to describe the following data
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Histogram Histogram is the best representation of quantitative data measured continuously, with no gaps between the bars.

Explanation for incorrect options: - OPTION A - Stem-and-leaf plots presentation is used for quantitative data. OPTION B - A pie chart displays categorical (qualitative) data. Stem-and-leaf plots presentation is used for a quantitative type of data. It is useful in quickly assessing whether the data follows a “normal” distribution by seeing whether the stem and leaf show a bell shape. OPTION D - Bar charts are used for a qualitative type of variable in which the variable studied is plotted in the form of a bar along the X-axis (horizontal), and the height of the bar is equal to the percentage or frequencies plotted along the Y-axis (vertical).

questions.text: The normal distribution is a probability function that describes how the values of a variable are distributed and is a symmetric distribution where most of the observations cluster around the central peak, and the probabilities for values further away from the mean taper off equally in both directions. Which of the following correctly describes the shape of a standard normal distribution curve?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Bell-shaped curve The normal distribution or 'normal curve' is an important concept in statistical theory. Let us suppose to quickly assess whether the data follows a “normal” distribution by seeing whether the stem and leaf are bell-shapedlikely to get a smooth, symmetrical curve. Such a curve is called a normal distribution or normal curve. Characteristics of a normal distribution curve Bilaterally symmetric bell-shaped curve Based on mean and Standard deviation Mean = median = mode = 0( all coincide) SD = 1 ( variance = 1) Area under curve = 1

questions.text: In statistics, the Gaussian distribution (also known as the normal distribution) is a bell-shaped curve. It is assumed that during any measurement, values will follow a normal distribution with an equal number of measurements above and below the mean value. Which of the following is true regarding the area under the normal distribution curve?

options.label: A
options.text: Mean ± 1 SD gives 95% area under the normal distribution curve.

options.label: B
options.text: Mean ± 2 SD gives 68% area under the normal distribution curve.

options.label: C
options.text: Mean ± 3 SD gives 99% area under the normal distribution curve.

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above are true

questions.correct_answer: C. Mean ± 3 SD gives 99% area under the normal distribution curve.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mean ± 3 SD gives 99% area under the normal distribution curve. The area under the curve in a normal distribution curve Mean ± 1 SD covers 68.2% of values Mean ± 2 SD covers 95.4% of values Mean ± 3 SD covers 99.7% of values

questions.text: A continuous probability distribution is a representation of a variable that can take a continuous range of values, and a probability density function is a function that describes the relative likelihood for a random variable to take on a given value. Mean + 1 SD gives the area value under the normal distribution curve being equal to which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

0.34 Here, Mean + 1 SD means the green area on the right side of the curve (half of 68%), i.e, 34%.

questions.text: In a standard normal curve, mean ± 2 standard deviation covers:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

95 Percent In a standard normal curve: Mean ± 1 standard deviation covers 68.3 % of values Mean ± 2 standard deviations cover 95.4 % of values, Mean ±3 standard deviations cover 99.7% of values in the distribution.

questions.text: In a classroom, there were 65 students. The body weight of the students was measured. The mean weight was 70 kg, and SD was 10 kg. 2.5% of students will weigh more than what weight?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

90 kg In the given question, MEAN = 70 kg, and SD will be = 10 kg. 95 % confidence interval will be – MEAN +/- 2SD= 50 to 90 kg. Now to the right of 90 kg lies 2.5% of the students who will weigh more than 90 kg. Hence the answer to this question will be option B.

questions.text: A classroom full of 100 students was subjected to a class test. The average passing mark for the test is 50 out of 100. The Standard deviation for the graph which will be formed is 10. What will be the 95% confidence interval for the students in this case?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

80-120 The given question's mean is 100, and the standard deviation is 10. The 95% confidence interval is given by the formula = MEAN +/- 2 SD. = 100 +/- 2(10) = 80 to 120. Hence, the 95% confidence interval will be 80 to 120, i.e., 95% of the students will have marks in the range of 80-120. So the answer is option D.

questions.text: A patient, age 76 years the male patient was admitted to the hospital, for 15 days, due to hospital-acquired pneumonia, which he got from a previous hospital stay due to an asthma attack. This was the 15 such cases that the doctor came across in his hospital. So he decided to find the average patient stay in his hospital. So he took a random sample of 1,000 discharges taken from the discharge database of a hospital, and a histogram was made of patient length of stay for the sample; which of the following is most likely true

options.label: A
options.text: The histogram will look approximately like a normal and appear to be positively skewed

options.label: B
options.text: The histogram will appear to be negatively skewed

options.label: C
options.text: The histogram will appear positively skewed

questions.correct_answer: C. The histogram will appear positively skewed
questions.explanation:
Solution:

The histogram will appear positively skewed The histogram will appear positively skewed Here, the doctor worried that his patients were getting hospital-acquired infections. ultimately increases the number of days of hospital stay. So he wanted to find the trend length of stay of patients in his hospital. He collected data from the database and depicted it in the histogram. He got a positively skewed histogram, which indicates the length of hospital stay is not increased in his hospital. Positively skewed graph means the majority of the population will fall on the left side of the graph. Very few on the right side, like in the case given here, the majority of patients get discharged from the hospital within 1-2 days, Very few patients have extended stays.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option A: Normal distribution curve means value in the central region is at the peak, and the value of the variable on the left and right sides declines gradually. Option B: Negatively skewed graph means values on the left extreme side are in maximum frequency. Option D: None of the above is ruled out as c is the answer

questions.text: The number of malaria cases reported during the last ten years in a town is 20, 20, 50, 56, 60, 5000, 678, 898, 345, 456. An epidemiologist wants to determine the average number of malaria cases reported in that town during the last 10 years. The most appropriate measure of average for this data would be which among the following?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Median Many jump to answer as Arithmetic mean. First, calculate the mean, median & mode first; the data shows this is a skewed distribution. Hence median is the best answer. Median: Data is skewed/ has outliers. The median is an average of a different kind, which does not depend upon the total and number of items. To obtain the median, the data is first arranged in an ascending or descending order of magnitude, and then the value of the middle observation is located, which is called the median.

questions.text: The normal distribution is a probability distribution that is symmetric about the mean, showing that data near the mean are more frequent in occurrence than data far from the mean. Which of the following statements is true concerning a normal distribution of data?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mean = Median = Mode The standard normal curve is a smooth bell-shaped symmetric curve based on an infinitely large number of observations. The total area of the curve = 1 Mean = 0 SD = 1 Mean, Median, and mode all coincide.

questions.text: Which statement is true concerning measures of central tendency?

options.label: A
options.text: Suppose more outlying observations are smaller than the rest of the values. In that case, the data are skewed to the right

options.label: B
options.text: If more outlying observation is larger than the rest of the values, the median will be smaller than the mean

options.label: C
options.text: If the data are skewed to the left, the mean is larger than the median

options.label: D
options.text: The median is more sensitive than the means to extreme observation

questions.correct_answer: B. If more outlying observation is larger than the rest of the values, the median will be smaller than the mean
questions.explanation:
Solution:

If more outlying observation is larger than the rest of the values, the median will be smaller than the mean When more outlying values are larger than the rest of the values, the data are said to be skewed to the right, and the median is smaller than the mean. If more outlying values are smaller than the rest, the data are said to be skewed to the left, and the median is larger than the mean. The median is more robust than the mean because it is less sensitive to extreme observations and is a more appropriate measure of central tendency when extreme values are part of the data set. Positively skewed distribution – Have a relatively large number of low scores and a small number of very high scores. Mean > median > mode Negatively skewed distribution – Mean < median < mode

questions.text: In a study, hemoglobin levels of girl children in the slums is studied and most are the value of 7mg/dL. Which among the following type of study is mentioned above?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Positively skewed Since the hemoglobin of most children is found to be 7mg/dl, the mode of the study is 7. Less number of children will have hemoglobin values above 7 mg/dl. The curve for the above distribution is positive/Right skewed.

questions.text: The following data gives the recorded age (years) of onset of diseases for a group of 25 patients suffering from HTN. 39, 50, 26, 45, 47, 51, 33, 40, 51, 66, 63, 55, 57, 41, 61, 47, 44, 48, 59, 36, 42, 54, 47, 53, 54. What is the average age of onset of HTN using Arithmetic mean?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

48.36 Sum of all the observations = 39+50+26+ 45+47+51+33+40+51+66+63+55+57+41+61+47+44+48+59+36+42+ 54+47+53+54 = 1209 Dividing sum of all observations by total no. of observations = 1209/25 Mean (x) = 48.36

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - OPTION A - Median is 48 OPTION B - 26 is the least age of onset of HTN in this data set and not an option. OPTION C - 47 is the mode of this data set.

questions.text: In statistics, the skew-normal distribution is a continuous probability distribution that generalizes the normal distribution to allow for non-zero skewness. Which of the following statements holds for figures A, B, and C? Graph A - median lies at centre equidistant from either quartiles and extreme values. Hence mean, median and mode coincide. Graph B-median(middlemost value in a data set) lies towards the 1st quartile (lower side of the mean). Graph C- median (middlemost value in a data set) lies towards the 3rd quartile (higher side of the mean).

options.label: A
options.text: A – Positively skewed, B – Normal distribution, C – Negatively skewed

options.label: B
options.text: A –Negatively skewed, B – Normal distribution, C – Positively skewed

options.label: C
options.text: A – Normal distribution, B – Positively distribution, C – Negatively skewed

options.label: D
options.text: A – Positively skewed, B – Negatively distribution, C – Negatively skewed

questions.correct_answer: C. A – Normal distribution, B – Positively distribution, C – Negatively skewed
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A – Normal distribution, B – Positively distribution, C – Negatively skewed Graph A – median lies at the centre equidistant from either quartiles and extreme values. Hence mean, median and mode coincide in Graph B – the median(middlemost value in a data set) lies towards the 1st quartile (lower side of the mean). Graph C - median(middlemost value in a data set) lies towards the 3rd quartile (higher side of the mean). Graph A - median lies at the centre equidistant from either quartiles and extreme values. Hence mean, median and mode coincide Graph B-median(middlemost value in a data set) lies towards the 1st quartile (lower side of the mean). Graph C- median (middlemost value in a data set) lies towards the 3rd quartile (higher side of the mean).

questions.text: A study of plasma thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) levels among 10,000 people includes 15 individuals with high TSH levels. Which of the following measures will most likely be affected by these values?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mean The arithmetic mean is calculated by adding up the values of each observation Dividing this total by the number of observations. The purpose of the arithmetic mean is to summarize a data collection using an expected value.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Median is the value obtained by arranging the observation in ascending or descending order, then dividing the observation into two equal groups. And the middle observation is taken as the median. Option: B. The value of the variable that occurs most frequently is called Mode. Option: D. None of the above

questions.text: Which of the following measures central tendency:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mode Information from a series of observations presented by rank in a sample or frequency distribution table is summarized by an observer to get answers to the following three questions: What is its average or central value? How are the other values dispersed around this value, or what is the degree of scatter? What is the shape of the distribution? Is it normal? The average value of a characteristic is the one central value around which all other observations are dispersed. Average is a general term that describes the center of a series. There are three common types of averages or measures of central position or central tendency— Mean, Median, Mode. They are summary indices describing the ‘central point or the most characteristic value’ of a set of measurements.

questions.text: The systolic blood pressure (mm Hg) of 20 individuals is below. Find the mean blood pressure. 98, 144, 123,111, 160, 123, 125, 130, 136, 132, 129, 132, 128, 130, 132, 136, 130, 107, 154 and 130.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

129.5 Sum of all the observations = 39+50+26+ 45+47+51+33+40+51+66+63+55+57+41+61+47+44+48+59+36+42+ 54+47+53+54 = 1209 Dividing sum of all observations by total no. of observations = 1209/25 Mean (x) = 48.36

questions.text: Which of the Statistical average takes into account all the numbers equally?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mean The arithmetic mean is widely used in statistical calculation. It is sometimes simply called Mean. To obtain the mean, the individual observations are first added together and then divided by the number of observations. As it considers all the values, it is most affected by outliers.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - OPTION B - The median is an average of a different kind, which does not depend upon the total and number of items. To obtain the median, the data is first arranged in an ascending or descending order of magnitude, and then, the value of the middle observation is located, called the median. OPTION C - The mode is the commonly occurring value in a data distribution. It is the most frequent value in a series of observations. OPTION D – Since the mean is the answer, none of the above doesn’t apply here.

questions.text: Any measure indicating the center of a set of data, arranged in an increasing or decreasing order of magnitude, is called a measure of
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Central tendency Central tendency gives the centrality measure of the data set, i.e., where the observations are concentrated. There are numerous measures of central tendency. These are: Mean; Median; Mode; Geometric Mean; Harmonic Mean.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - OPTION A - A horizontal stretching of a frequency distribution to one side or the other so that one tail of observations is longer and has more observations than the other is called skewness. OPTION C - A symmetric distribution is one in which the left and right sides mirror each other. The most well-known symmetric distribution is the normal distribution, which has a distinct bell shape. OPTION D - Statistical dispersion means the extent to which numerical data will likely vary about an average value.

questions.text: Which of the following terms best describes the distribution in the chart below
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Bimodal In statistics, a bimodal distribution is a probability distribution with two different modes, which may also be called bimodal distribution. These appear as distinct peaks (local maxima) in the probability density function.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - OPTION B – A unimodal distribution only has one peak in the distribution OPTION C – The range in statistics for a given data set is the difference between the highest and lowest values. OPTION D – A trimodal distribution is a frequency distribution of a certain phenotype with three peaks separated by two antinodes.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a measure of central tendency?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Range Range is the difference between the highest and lowest values. Central tendency gives the centrality measure of the data set, i.e., where the observations are concentrated. There are numerous measures of central tendency. These are: Mean; Median; Mode; Geometric Mean; Harmonic Mean.
